multipart/form-data.example:
--Boundary_1_590503263_1680290024614
Content-Type: application/json
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="metadata"

{
  "name": "bgp_config_1",
  "description": "Configuration for BGP integration."
}

--Boundary_1_590503263_1680290024614
Content-Type: text/plain
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="bgp_config_1.config"

router bgp 1112
 bgp router-id 127.0.0.1
 bgp dampening 15 750 2000 61

--Boundary_1_590503263_1680290024614--

--Boundary_1_590503263_1680290024614
Content-Type: application/json
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="metadata"

{
  "name": "geoip_config_1",
  "description": "Configuration for GeoIP integration.",
  "type": "IPV4"
}

--Boundary_1_590503263_1680290024614
Content-Type: text/plain
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="geoip_config_1.config"

"1.0.0.0","1.0.0.253","16777216","16777471","AU","Australia"

--Boundary_1_590503263_1680290024614--

config.description: The metadata portion is the JSON configuration describing the mapping object.

name.description: A unique name for the entity.

type.description: Type of GeoIP data. Specifies the address type used in the GeoIP configuration file. `IPV4` indicates the GeoIP configuration file uses an IPv4 address. `IPV6` indicates the GeoIP configuration file uses an IPv6 address, `ZIP` indicates a MaxMind GeoIP2 zip file of both.

201.description: An HTTP 201 will be returned if the request is successfully processed, and a new geoip-config object is created.  The location of the new object will be specified in the location header.
